description: Etobicoke is a relaxed area along the Humber River. It's saturated with green spaces and conservatories, making it a premier destination for outdoor sports, hiking, and nature walks. Its abundance of parkland and lakes makes it a typical spot for fishing, picnicking, and camping out, especially in warmer months. The peaceful area is also enjoyed by families, who appreciate its boardwalks and sports facilities. Locals enjoy the variety of golfing and country club opportunities, which also provide lessons for golfers of any skill level.

reviews.title: Unfriendly -  not customer centric.
text: How does an entertainment venue survive when the staff make you feel like they are doing you a favour.  Would make for a good Seinfeld episode.   Cost on a Monday night for two tickets, large pop corn, coke and liquorice…..plus street parking was $65.

reviews.title: Unwelcoming atmosphere, do not recommend
text: It had an unfriendly and unwelcoming atmosphere. There are several other better options for good cinema in the city. Would not recommend this one.

reviews.title: It's a great theatre
text: Always a blast, always a treat.
The staff are nice, and the flicks are sweet.

That rhymed, and i was done with the review but i need to have at least 100 characters so here's the remainder. Seriously though, its always a great time going to the kingsway.  Also, with less and less older theatres like this in Toronto it's really nice that it's still around. The atmosphere in the lobby is great, there are lots of snack options, and also beer/cocktail options if you're so inclined. You can see an older movie like Rosemary's Baby on the weekend, or something newer like Dune during the week. Really its just a great place. I've encountered rude staff a total of zero times. The George Orwell clip has definitely lost all effect at this point though and is mostly just funny. If you know you know.

reviews.title: Great retro experience
text: A blast from the past in the best way  reasonable prices, short line ups and wide seats. Great movie selection.

reviews.title: Physically Aggressive and Rude Manager violates Covid 19 Rules
text: Horrible experience! I can't rate the actual theatre, as we never got to the point of actually purchasing tickets. The manager/owner was ready to sell us movie tickets without asking for any proof of vaccination (now required at movie theatres). When I asked if he required proof of vaccination, he said that if I had it I could show it to him. I stated that yes I had it, but for my own safety,  I wanted to know that other people in the theatre were also screened. He said that’s not the way it works and that If I have proof of vaccination I can show it to him. He refused to confirm whether patrons were being screened for proof of vaccination. I advised that we did not want to go into the theatre unless we knew that others were screened for vaccination. There were other patrons in the line asking the same questions; also concerned about the lack of screening. He then stated that we were causing trouble and that we better leave or he would call police. On my way out, he squeezed my arm and very aggressively pushed me out of the theatre. No wonder there are so many reviews of his altercations with customers. Outside I asked many people leaving from the previous show, whether or not they had to show proof of vaccination- they all said that they had not. And when we first arrived, the manager was making popcorn wearing a shield which was pushed up on top of his head and no mask. I'd really love to be able to support this little neighbourhood theatre, but unless there is a change in management, I sure won't be going back!  Extremely rude and aggressive treatment of customers.

reviews.title: Rude, aggressive, mean owner
text: Aggressively rude owner doesn't follow COVID vaccine protocol.

Owner (the only person working at the theatre) was making popcorn, his shield pushed way up on his head and he was not wearing a mask. He pulled his shield over his face (but still didn't wear a mask) when he finally came to sell us tickets. He refused to answer our question as to whether he checks for proof of COVID vaccination, and, when we persisted and said we do not wish to purchase tickets if he does not screen for proof of vaccination, he kicked us out. He physically and extremely aggressively pushed my friend out the door, then locked the door. The only other party waiting to purchase tickets ran out after us, telling us he had chased them out as well because they wanted to know if patrons were vaccinated. The owner's rude unwillingness to answer our question (he kept saying, "this is not how it works") and his aggression were scary. Avoid this theatre at all costs!

reviews.title: An enjoyable must see
text: A charming OLD movie theatre that claims it originally opened in 1939. Last of the independents. The interior decor appears to support this claim. Old it may be, but it is maintained in very good condition. The building actually contains two movie viewing rooms. The larger one is on the main floor and a smaller one on the second floor. Seats are comfortable and kept in good condition. The lobby also has a quaint old style Bistro size Cafe with an interesting menu of food items, everything from grilled cheese sandwiches to hamburgers and also serves beer and wine. Of course the front counter also serves the usual movie theatre fare of popcorn etc..

reviews.title: Don't go to the Kingsway if you want to be tested with respect. There are lots.of other theatres in town
text: The management has a policy of not allowing customers to take their backpack ino the theatre. Why they have this policy we are only left to guess because if you should have the temerity to ask, the management/front line staff is extremely high-handed, rude, disrespectful, dictatorial and argumentative in response to any question. Not only that, they seem to enjoy throwing their weight around with the attitude,"this is my theatre and if you don't like the rules, buzz off before we call the police and get you thrown out". Yes, they actually threaten to call the police at the least question you should ask. Go figure! And don't go!

reviews.title: A step back in time. . .
text: As soon as you step through the door you realize you've entered somewhere very different!  The decor, although a little worse for wear, is a charming throwback to another era.  There is a small waiting area and bar where you can enjoy a drink, beer, wine, coffee, tea, soda, etc. plus a selection of usual movie snacks.  The lone employee on a Saturday afternoon was a "Jill of all trades"' selling tickets, refreshments, and ushering us into the theatre at movie time.  It is a large auditorium with very comfy seats and plenty of leg room.  It was so nice to sit comfortably and just watch the movie - no silly games, no endless trailers and commercials, the movie just started at the stated time.  I was with my daughter and after the movie we both commented what en enjoyable experience it was to see a movie at this theatre.  Can't wait to go back.

reviews.title: Owner is Very Mean and Horrible
text: Do not go to this theatre unless you want to be verbally abused by the owner. I ordered a drink from the concession. The young server asked how I wanted the drink. The owner, hiding behind the counter, berated the server. He scolded her relentlessly. Apparently, she asked a question she shouldn't have. The server maintained her composure, but the way he talked to her made me feel very uncomfortable. I spoke up and told him I didn't feel comfortable with the way he talked to her. He said he didn't want me feeling uncomfortable and insisted he refund our tickets. He kicked us out! The owner clearly needs to take an anger management course. What a horrible person. I will never go back. Plus it's overpriced.

reviews.title: Disappointing Nostalgia
text: Grew up in this neighbourhood during the 50's and 60's and this was always a Saturday matinee place to go. However, moved to the west and haven't been at this theatre since it closed during its REVIEW CINEMAS days but always glad to see one of the oldest movie venues in Toronto has re-opened for the neighbourhood.

It has been turned into a "bar" showing movies which is quite a unique idea. We found a movie which had gone out of the first-run theatres and went to see it there. Unfortunately, the movie was in the upstairs (formerly NOSTALGIA CINEMA) which has been re-worked into "The Screening Room". A small venue with new, comfortable seats but too close to the wall-sized screen. And the movie was dark and grainy with very poor sound. Very disappointing!
Nice to be able to have a beer or a glass of wine with the show but with admission being the same full price as first-run theatres this venue doesn't hold up to the big screens at the same price.
Our cheepo CINESTARZ in Mississauga is a much better bang for the buck.

reviews.title: Old Theatre with character but overpriced and smelly
text: Have been here on occasion but now avoid it due to mouldy smell, uncomfortable seats and bad attitude manager.

reviews.title: It's cool,has a bar and is a classic cinema
text: It us indeed very retro cool with big seats, a bar, beer, even grilled cheese sandwiches. I want to love this place, but for 16 bucks a show cannot. Sadly, for such major money I want the high tech modern theatres. The fox theatre on the East side does the same, but for less. Alas...Saw a film with four other people one cold day. Marketing team help keep this place alive.

reviews.title: Additional noise
text: We got to the theater at an appropriate time and unfortunately we had to wait as the other playing had not finished. No big deal. The movie LBJ started and it was good movie except for the continuing banging of metal pipes on the other side of the wall. Assumed the owner was doing some plumbing repairs. Snacks and especially the popcorn is way over priced. All I can say to the owner is please smarten up

reviews.title: New way to experience movies... the old way
text: I visited this movie theatre with a friend and I loved this place. It's like going back in time when no big cinema complexes were available. Staff is super friendly and the films offered are highly recommended. Make it a full evening out pairing your movie with some wine or beer.

reviews.title: snackless snack bar
text: They were out of my first choice (caramel corn).  They were also out of my second choice (kettle chips).  I was told that my third choice (ice-cream) would be brought to me in my seat;  I didn't receive it at all!!  I can fully understand why people may want to bring in their own snacks.

reviews.title: Bizarre rules, unfriendly atmosphere
text: I wanted to like this place. I live downtown so am not often in this neighbourhood, but I went with a friend wanted to see a film that was no longer playing at cineplex. I am a movie buff and have a particular soft spot for old-school theatres like this one, which is much like the kind I attended growing up in 1970s. I much prefer these to megaplexes. But as soon as you enter Kingsway, you sense an unfriendly, unwelcoming atmosphere. The popcorn counter, where you also buy your tickets, has a series of signs posted telling you what you are not allowed to do, with no, no, no everywhere..No Refunds! No exchanges! No outside food or drink! No plastic water bottles! (are you kidding me??) No backpacks or large purses!! (Again, are they serious??) In fact, they are, and I was told I had to leave my backpack with them while I watched the movie. For what reason?  Utterly bizarre No other theatre I have attended, including TIFF, Hot Docs or Mirvish theatres, which all sell alcohol as well, have told me I could not enter the auditorium with a backpack. To top off the "friendly" welcome while you wait, there is a giant video screen behind the popcorn stand showing you and others in the line on camera as you wait in line to buy a ticket..the kind of screen a large shopping mall or bank might use in the security office to keep an eye on crime. In a movie theatre?? Really??

The auditorium itself was fine, with a large screen and good sound. But I would think twice before returning, here, simply because of the completely unfriendly atmosphere. I don't like being treated as if I am suspected of wrongdoing the minute I walk in.

reviews.title: not worth it
text: I had previously been to this theatre and enjoyed its old-school atmosphere.  I tolerated the late showings (often 15 minutes late) and the moldy smell of the theatre because I believed in supporting independent theatres and I enjoyed the films that were screened.  Recently, however, I was told not to bring my purse/backpack into the theatre.  I allowed the clerk to look in my bag but was told not to bring it in.  I then asked to speak to the owner and was told that his information would not be provided to me.  I did find his contact information online and sent him a message.  I got a response from him that wasn't appropriate or professional.  Alas, I will not be frequenting this establishment unless there's a change in ownership.  I will also be telling all my friends and family not to frequent his establishment.

reviews.title: OLD MOVIE HOUSE
text: I would never go to this cinema again. They charge $12-00 for seniors on the weekend, which is outrageous given that you can go to a modern cinema with stadium seating for under $10

As well, If you have anything that even resembles a backpack, you are obliged to take out what you need from it at are not allowed to take it into the cinema. This is outrageous as I have taken the same bag (it is not a rucksack or backpacK) I have taken it into every other cinema and never have I been told that I cannot take it into a cinema.

reviews.title: Last chance to see The Martian turned out to be the best!
text: Remember when going to the movies was a more personal, memorable experience? Well that's what my son and I got last night when we headed to the Kingsway. From the small, old school entrance, to the original style theatre, to the retro previews, ads and a great 60's Martian-themed trailer before we watched the Martian, it was a great experience. Free refills on jumbo drinks and jumbo popcorn provided additional value and a cozy, licensed bar and licensed snack counter meant you can enjoy a cocktail beer or wine while you watched. This would also be a great place for a date - uncrowded, intimate and private with a great selection of late run, niche, and old time classic movies. Why bring a date to that generic, sterile giganto-saurus experience when this gem is still out there. I will definitely be back!!!

reviews.title: Fun evening out
text: Despite the worn out look of the actual movie theatre (worn chairs, peeling paint), it's worth coming out here even once just to enjoy the retro look of the lobby and little bar.  The second run films are good too.

reviews.title: Lovely Old Theatre
text: The theatre is charming, comfortable with all the ambiance of those movie-going days - complete with soda fountain.  The variety of movies is amazing.  The show are constantly rotating which make viewing very convenient.
